summary: This is an email exchange between US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff regarding vacation plans, with a brief mention that a draft Epstein prosecution memo and indictment will be prepared while the sender is away. It shows internal office communication around the time of Epstein's prosecution.

persons.name: Unknown
persons.context: Sender of the main email announcing vacation to Bermuda and mentioning that a draft Epstein prosecution memo and indictment will be prepared before their return.

events.title: Staff vacation to Bermuda
events.description: A staff member from the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York is heading to Bermuda with family.

events.title: Preparation of Epstein prosecution documents
events.description: The email indicates that a draft Epstein prosecution memo and indictment will be prepared while the staff member is on vacation.

locations: Office (likely US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The email is dated June 14, 2019, shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
It confirms that the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively preparing a prosecution memo and indictment against Epstein in June 2019.
The communication shows internal coordination within the prosecution team regarding timing and workload around vacation schedules.
